thread.title: Seattle Seahawks’ Kam Chancellor takes to Twitter to protest fine from NFL
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks’ Kam Chancellor takes to Twitter to protest fine from NFL

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks’ Kam Chancellor takes to Twitter to protest fine from NFL
text:
Seattle Seahawks’ Kam Chancellor takes to Twitter to protest fine from NFL Originally published October 24, 2015 at 1:40 pm Seattle Seahawks' Kam Chancellor has taken to Twitter to protest a fine levied on him for a hit in last Sunday's game against Carolina. 
Seattle Seahawks’ Kam Chancellor has taken to Twitter to protest a fine he was levied Friday for a hit in the Carolina game last Sunday. 
Chancellor was fined $23,152 for a spear on Carolina’s Ryan Kalil. The fine game though there was no penalty on the play (Kalil left the game for one play and then returned). 
Chancellor wrote on Twitter sarcastically “Welcome to the NFL kids!! !!” saying that the hit came “unintentionally.” 
Players can appeal fines, and sometimes can win, though those results are not always made as public as the fines. Most Read Stories
